0.title: Chadwick Boseman honoured with Disney Legends Award posthumously
0.article_body: Late actor Chadwick Boseman, known for portraying 'Black Panther', was honoured with the Disney Legends Award posthumously on Friday at D23 Expo. His brother Derrick Boseman accepted the trophy on his behalf. Derrick said in his speech, "[Chadwick] honoured his scripts with his love, his blood, his sweat, his tears. As he played these roles, he was taking chemo simultaneously."

1.title: Pitiable: Baghel on BJP sharing pic of Rahul's Burberry t-shirt
1.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel reacted to BJP sharing a picture of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi wearing a Burberry t-shirt, which reportedly costs ₹41,257, saying, "This is pitiable...when one party is uniting the country, the party that's dividing...is clinging to t-shirts and khaki shorts." Congress leader Pawan Khera also reacted to this, saying, "Those with shorts will only look at...t-shirt."

2.title: State-run OMCs to run fuel stations on solar power by 2024: Govt
2.article_body: The Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas said that all state-run oil marketing companies (OMCs) will run their entire network of petrol and diesel retail stations on solar power by 2024. OMCs, including Indian Oil Corporation Ltd, Bharat Petroleum Corporation Ltd and Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Ltd, together have around 75,000 fuel stations across India that will deploy solar panels.

3.title: India, US to hold next Trade Policy Forum meet soon: Piyush Goyal
3.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal said India and the US will hold the next ministerial-level meeting of the Trade Policy Forum (TPF) in US soon. He further said that officials from both countries will firm up more deliverables and newer areas of engagement. Goyal also held a bilateral meeting with US Trade Representative Katherine Tai and US Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo.

4.title: Certain people enjoy masala: Rakul on romance angle in 'Cuttputlli'
4.article_body: Speaking about 'Cuttputlli' being criticised for the romance angle, actress Rakul Preet Singh said that Indian films are known for the "quintessential masala". She added that there is a certain section of the audience that enjoys the romance and song-dance. "People want entertainment...If the story is thrilling and intense, a little bit of breather...makes it a family watch," Rakul said.

5.title: I'm scared of snakes, shot scene with real snake thinking it was fake: Big B
5.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan has revealed that he is scared of snakes and recalled an incident when he had to shoot a scene with a snake coming out of his chest. "They told me that we will keep a fake rubber snake...During the shoot, I was holding the snake...Later I got to know...the snake was not fake, it was...real," he said.

6.title: 5 killed after boat collides with whale in New Zealand: Report
6.article_body: Five people were reportedly killed after a small charter boat collided with a whale and capsized in New Zealand. The accident took place on Saturday morning near the South Island town of Kaikoura. The town is a popular whale-watching destination, while sperm whales are usually seen in the area. Some humpback whales also pass through.

7.title: 'Brahmāstra' ending is superb, but it will take time to build: Neetu
7.article_body: In a video shared by a media account, veteran actress Neetu Kapoor can be heard telling 'Brahmāstra' director Ayan Mukerji that the film's ending is superb. She can further be heard saying, "It is outstanding, amazing. But it will...initially it takes time to build. But once the film takes off." The video was taken at a special screening of 'Brahmāstra'.

8.title: The real Kohli wasn't batting during the first 50 runs: Akhtar on Kohli's 122*
8.article_body: Shoaib Akhtar said the "real Virat Kohli" wasn't batting during the first 50 runs of Kohli's 122* (61) in the Asia Cup match against Afghanistan. Akhtar added that he saw the real Kohli bat during the last 50 runs of the knock. Talking about Virat Kohli being a potential opener in T20Is, Akhtar stated, "Don't get confused...thinking [like] that."

9.title: Teacher pours boiling water on 7-yr-old boy for defecating in school uniform in K'taka
9.article_body: A 7-year-old Class 2 student suffered 40% burns after his teacher allegedly threw hot water on him for defecating in his school uniform in Karnataka's Raichur district, police said. The boy has been admitted to Lingasugur taluk hospital and is undergoing treatment. "We have information about the incident but haven't received any complaint regarding the matter," police added.

10.title: At least 3 killed, 11 injured as trains collide in Croatia
10.article_body: At least three people were killed and 11 others were injured after a passenger train and freight train collided on Friday night in Croatia, authorities said. Both trains were pushed off the rails after the collision. The passenger train was carrying 13 people, while the engine driver was the only person in the freight train, Croatian PM Andrej Plenkovic said.

11.title: Police bust Lashkar-e-Taiba terror module in J&K's Sopore, 2 arrested
11.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir Police on Friday arrested two people from Sopore after busting an overground worker (OGW) module of the Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT). Police also recovered two grenades from the arrested persons, ANI reported. During the inquiry, the detained pair divulged identities of other OGW accomplices, leading to the arrest and recovery of more weaponry and ammunition, reports added.

12.title: Construction material falls on workers in Noida; 1 dead, 4 injured
12.article_body: A 22-year-old labourer was killed and four others were injured after construction material fell on them when the rope tied around it broke in Noida on Friday. The construction material, which included iron rods, was attached to a tower crane, the police said. An FIR has been filed against four people including the construction company's director, Additional DCP (Noida) said.

13.title: India skips US-led IPEF's trade pillar, to join 3 other pillars
13.article_body: India has not joined the US-led Indo-Pacific Economic Framework for Prosperity's (IPEF) 'trade pillar'. US Trade Representative Katherine Tai said, "I wouldn't characterise it as opting out, India isn't in...trade pillar right now." She added India and US have their bilateral and trade policy forum. However, India will join the three other pillars–supply chain, clean economy and fair economy.

14.title: Yami's 'Lost' to premiere at Chicago South Asian Film Fest opening night
14.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam has announced that her film 'Lost' will be premiering on the opening night of the 13th Annual Chicago South Asian Film Festival. The event will be attended by director Aniruddha Roy Chowdhury, Yami and actor Rahul Khanna. The film will premiere on September 23 and will be followed by a question-answer session with the team of 'Lost'.

15.title: Reliance arm to buy SPL, SPTex's polyester business for ₹1,592 cr
15.article_body: Reliance Petroleum Retail Limited, a subsidiary of Reliance Industries Limited, will acquire the polyester business of Shubhalakshmi Polyesters Limited (SPL) and Shubhlaxmi Polytex Limited (SPTex) for ₹1,522 crore and ₹70 crore, respectively in a slump sale on a going concern basis. The acquisitions are subject to approvals from the Competition Commission of India and the lenders of SPL and SPTex.

16.title: Amazon to stop selling seat belt alarm blockers in US, UK after Mistry's car crash
16.article_body: Amazon will remove listings of products that disable car seat belt alarms in US and UK, a day after the e-commerce platform did the same in India. The development comes after former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry died in a car crash last weekend. Mistry, who was in the rear seat, wasn't wearing seat belt at the time of crash.

17.title: Pics show cards, balloons, flowers at gates of Buckingham Palace after Queen's demise
17.article_body: People in the UK paid their respects to Queen Elizabeth II after her demise by leaving flowers, balloons and cards among other things at the gates of the Buckingham Palace in London. Thousands of people gathered outside Buckingham Palace amid rain. Portraits of the Queen were reportedly posted on billboard screens in central London's Piccadilly Circus and Canary Wharf.

18.title: Mining mafia attacks police, officials in Haryana's Nuh; 50 booked
18.article_body: A police constable was injured after the mining mafia attacked a joint team of police and other officials during a raid at an illegal mining site in Haryana's Nuh, police said on Friday. A juvenile was apprehended and an FIR has been filed against some identified people and around 40-50 unidentified people, a police officer said.

19.title: 14 cows die at Ludhiana shelter, contaminated fodder suspected
19.article_body: At least 14 cows were found dead at a shelter in the Samrala town of Ludhiana district on Friday. Dr Jaswinder Kaur, a veterinary specialist, suspected it to be a case of contaminated fodder after traces of nitrate were found in it. She said that fodder producers spray chemicals to increase yield, which could prove fatal if fed directly.

20.title: Shah Rukh Khan appointed as ambassador by UAE's Burjeel Holdings
20.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan has been appointed as the brand ambassador for UAE's private healthcare services provider Burjeel Holdings. Burjeel Holdings is owned by UAE-based Indian entrepreneur Shamsheer Vayalil. This is Shah Rukh's first role as a healthcare ambassador. The actor said, "Meeting employees and witnessing the immense passion and pride they have in their work was humbling."

21.title: Nurse saves baby who stopped breathing on US flight; video surfaces
21.article_body: A nurse on board a Spirit Airlines flight from US' Pittsburgh to Orlando saved a baby who'd stopped breathing midair on Thursday. The video of the incident was shared by Ian Cassette, a meteorologist for Fox 35 television station in Orlando, on Twitter. According to the meteorologist, the three-month-old baby's lips had gone purple, following which nurse Tamara Panzino intervened.

22.title: 4 including 2 minor brothers die after taking 70-80 feet fall as SUV hits bike in Nagpur
22.article_body: Four members of a family were killed after they were flung into air when a Sports Utility Vehicle (SUV) rammed into their motorcycle in Maharashtra's Nagpur on Friday, police said. Reports said that the four deceased took a 70 to 80 feet fall before they died. Among the deceased are two minor boys, aged five and eleven years.

23.title: Bezos' ex-wife MacKenzie donates 2 mansions in California worth $55 million
23.article_body: MacKenzie Scott, the ex-wife of Amazon Founder and the world's second richest person Jeff Bezos, has donated two mansions in California's Beverly Hills for a total of $55 million. Bezos and Scott had purchased the properties while they were married. Scott received sole ownership of these homes following her divorce from Bezos in 2019 after 25 years of marriage.

24.title: If I was Rohit, I'd tell Avesh 'Tell me if you can't bowl 140+': Akram
24.article_body: Sharing the conversation he would have with pacer Avesh Khan if he was Rohit Sharma, Wasim Akram said, "I'll tell...Avesh, 'I want you to bowl over 140 kmph, if you can't bowl...tell me'." "I don't want...135 kmph line, length bowlers," added Akram. "If Avesh cannot [bowl quick] what's the point of having him in the team," he stated.

25.title: Former RJD MLC's son arrested for misbehaving with DSP in Patna
25.article_body: Former RJD MLC Anwar Ahmed's son Afshar was arrested for allegedly misbehaving with the DSP and others inside a police station in Bihar's Patna on Friday. Afshar was reportedly forcing police to let a man go who allegedly attacked police during a raid. "He (Afshar) said...he'll come back with 5,000 people and give it a different angle," the DSP said.

26.title: If stray dogs attack people, those who feed them could be held liable: Supreme Court
26.article_body: While hearing petitions in connection with the stray dogs' menace in Kerala, Supreme Court Justice Sanjiv Khanna said that people who feed stray dogs "will be responsible for vaccinating them and bearing the cost if a person is attacked". The Supreme Court bench said that a balance has to be maintained between the safety of people and animal rights.

27.title: PM Modi inaugurates 2-day Centre-State Science Conclave virtually
27.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday inaugurated the Centre-State Science Conclave being held from September 10 to 11 in Ahmedabad via video conferencing. "Investment in science and technology has increased since 2014," he said. "We have to make India a global centre of research and innovation in this 'Amrit Kaal'. States should adopt best practices from other states," he added.

28.title: 1.8-million-year-old human tooth found in Georgia; pic released
28.article_body: A 1.8-million-year-old tooth belonging to an early species of human has been found by archaeologists in Georgia. The tooth was discovered near the village of Orozmani, around 100 km southwest of the Georgian capital of Tbilisi. The village is near Dmanisi where human skulls dated to 1.8 million years old were found in the late 1990s and early 2000s.

29.title: I'm from middle-class family, watched films only when I scored well: Rakul
29.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh has said that she comes from a middle-class family and could not watch all the films that were released when she was growing up. "My dad would say, 'Okay, you score well. So you watch that film, you do this.' So...it was tough," the actress added. Rakul was last seen in Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Cuttputlli'.

30.title: Bolsonaro supporter kills Lula fan as Brazil Prez election nears
30.article_body: Ahead of the Brazilian Presidential polls in October, a supporter of President Jair Bolsonaro killed a backer of rival candidate Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva during an argument, authorities said on Friday. The 24-year-old accused has been arrested, police said, adding that Rafael Silva de Oliveira has confessed to the crime. Bolsonaro is currently trailing in the polls.

31.title: Alia Bhatt is the most focused actor in film industry: Shefali Shah
31.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah has stated in an interview that Alia Bhatt is the most focused actor in the film industry. The two shared screen space together in Alia's first production venture 'Darlings'. Speaking about her career, Shefali said her potential was not tapped well before she did the series 'Delhi Crime', adding, "Better late than never perfectly describes my journey."

32.title: Please don't leak spoilers of 'Brahmāstra' on social media: Ranbir
32.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor, who recently held a special screening of 'Brahmāstra: Part One – Shiva' for fans, requested them not to leak any spoilers on social media. He can be heard saying in a video, "The audience who has not seen it would like to experience it." Ranbir also signed autographs and clicked selfies with fans at the event.

33.title: Ex-Tesla CFO Deepak Ahuja to join US drone delivery startup Zipline
33.article_body: Ex-Tesla CFO Deepak Ahuja will join San Francisco-based drone delivery startup Zipline as its first Chief Business and Financial Officer. "Rarely do I see this level of disruption and impact paired with the world-class technology that Zipline's team is building," Ahuja said. He'll be leaving his post of CFO at Alphabet's Verily Life Sciences to join Zipline on September 30.

34.title: 3 people try to sell baby girl for ₹4.5 lakh, arrested in Faridabad
34.article_body: Haryana CM's Flying Squad has arrested three people after they were caught red-handed while trying to sell a six-month-old girl in Faridabad. A member of the squad had posed as a buyer and the trio agreed to sell the baby for ₹4.5 lakh, officials said. The trio revealed that they'd sold a child earlier in Delhi, a sub-inspector said.

35.title: 'After Aashiqui 2', 'Ek Villain', I thought I'll write a book: Shraddha
35.article_body: Actress Shraddha Kapoor recently launched the book 'Treasure Trove' written by 8-year-old Arya and read out a chapter at the event. Shraddha said she thought it would be great to write a book. "It was around 2014, my film 'Aashiqui 2' had already released, later 'Ek Villain' released as well...I...started understanding the creative process of what I do," she added.

36.title: Rahul Gandhi begins 4th day of 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' from Kanniyakumari
36.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi began the fourth day of the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' from Kanniyakumari's Mulagumoodu on Saturday. The party aims to cover about 3,570 km journey from Kanniyakumari to Kashmir during the campaign which kicked off on Wednesday. On Friday, Gandhi said the 'yatra' is an attempt to "undo the damage caused by the BJP and RSS".

37.title: Have always tried to maintain harmony with govt: Raj Guv Kalraj Mishra
37.article_body: Rajasthan Governor Kalraj Mishra said that he has always tried to maintain harmony with Ashok Gehlot-led Congress government in the state. "If there is a difficulty at any level and of any kind, then it is addressed through continuous dialogue and communication," Mishra said while talking to reporters to mark the completion of his three years as Governor of Rajasthan.

38.title: Journalist Siddique likely to be released next week from UP jail: Official
38.article_body: Journalist Siddique Kappan who was arrested under Unlawful Activities Prevention Act (UAPA) is likely to be released from the Lucknow jail next week, an official said. SC granted him bail on Friday and stated that every person has right to free expression. He was arrested while he was on his way to Hathras where a Dalit woman had died.

39.title: UK envoy condoles Queen's demise in Hindi, says 'Maharani Elizabeth ko yaad kiya jayega'
39.article_body: British High Commissioner to India Alex Ellis spoke in Hindi while condoling Queen Elizabeth II's demise. "Maharani Elizabeth ko unke jeevan, nishtha...aur kartaviya seva ke liye United Kingdom,  Bharat, Commonwealth ke desho, puri duniya mein yaad kiya jayega...Queen Elizabeth had a long life, an exemplary life of strength, duty, hard work and dignity," Ellis said.

40.title: King Charles told Harry not to bring wife Meghan to see dying Queen: Report
40.article_body: King Charles told his son Harry not to bring wife Meghan Markle to Balmoral Castle as he and other senior Royals rushed to see dying Queen, a source told The Sun. "Charles made it very, very clear Meghan would not be welcome," the source reportedly said. Harry was at Frogmore Cottage when he received a call from his father.

41.title: Car in Mistry's accident was at 100 kmph speed seconds before crash: Mercedes report
41.article_body: The car in which former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry was killed, was running at a speed of 100 kmph seconds before the accident, according to a preliminary report submitted by Mercedes-Benz. Its speed was 89 kmph when it hit the divider, Palghar Superintendent of Police said citing the report, adding that the brakes were applied five seconds before crash.

42.title: I signed 3 films even after 'Love Aaj Kal 2' flopped: Kartik Aaryan
42.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan has stated in an interview that he signed three films after the critical and commercial failure of 2020 film 'Love Aaj Kal 2'. "After playing two roles in the film, filmmakers started seeing me in that light," he said. The actor further said that director Imtiaz Ali's "magic" presented his serious side in the film.

43.title: India reports 5,554 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 48,850
43.article_body: India has reported 5,554 fresh COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The data showed that 6,322 people recovered in the last 24 hours. This comes a day after 6,093 COVID-19 cases were reported in the country. Active cases in India stand at 48,850.

44.title: Instagram tests 'reposts' feature for resharing posts in feed
44.article_body: Meta's Instagram is testing a new feature that will allow users to repost other users' posts in their own feeds. "We plan to test this soon with a small number of people," Meta said. Currently, users can share someone's posts in their Stories. Reportedly, users will be able to see all reshared posts in a separate tab on their profiles.

45.title: 'Machis ki dibbi' worth thousands of crores: Baghel on ministry building
45.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel called the ministry building in Naya Raipur a 'machis ki dibbi' (matchbox). Calling it a symbol of corruption, he alleged that the BJP spent thousands of crores of rupees to build it but it is in ruins today. "When the wind blows, the walls shake and the windows rattle," he said.

46.title: Copyright lawsuit against Fortis Healthcare dismissed by US court
46.article_body: A US court dismissed a copyright lawsuit filed by Emqore Envesecure against Fortis Healthcare and others, including IHH Healthcare Berhad, Fortis said. The suit was dismissed on grounds of 'forum non conveniens', which is a discretionary power allowing courts to dismiss a case where another court/forum is better suited to hear the case. Emqore had sought $6.5 billion in damages.

47.title: 19-yr-old who put college on hold to build his crypto startup raises $30 mn in US
47.article_body: Tate Berenbaum, the 19-year-old Founder of Community Labs, has raised $30 million in funding for his crypto startup. Berenbaum told Bloomberg that he has moved to New York and has put his first year at the University of Virginia on hold to build the startup. He further said he spent most of the time coding in his basement during COVID-19.

48.title: My wife & 2 kids perished, I lost everything: Then Taj hotel GM on 26/11 attacks
48.article_body: Karambir Kang, who was the Taj Mahal Palace hotel's General Manager during 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks, urged the international community at a UN convention to act against terrorism. "My wife and two young sons could not escape and died during the attack, I lost everything...Our company and staff...have spent 14 long and painful years trying to seek justice," he said.

49.title: Everything runs on fakeness in Bollywood: Vivek on 'Brahmāstra'
49.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri shared a report saying 'Brahmāstra' led to ₹800 crore loss for two theatre chains, writing on Twitter, "Problem is everything runs on fakeness in Bollywood." The filmmaker further wrote, "And nobody is answerable. No industry can survive which invests 0% in R&D and wastes 70-80% money on stars." 'Brahmāstra' features Ranbir Kapoor, Alia Bhatt and Amitabh Bachchan.

50.title: Missing boy found murdered in Pune; father received ₹20 cr ransom call
50.article_body: A seven-year-old boy, who was reported missing, was found murdered on the premises of a company on Friday in Pune's Pimpri Chinchwad, police said. The father of the boy, who was last seen playing near his residence, had allegedly received a ransom call demanding ₹20 crore. The police said that they're investigating to confirm the cause behind the murder.

51.title: FM Sitharaman asks RBI to prepare 'whitelist' of legal loan apps
51.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has asked the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) to prepare a "whitelist" of all the legal lending apps to single out those illegal apps using unethical means to exploit customers. The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology will ensure that app stores such as Google Play Store or Apple App Store only host these "whitelist" apps.

52.title: A threat to peace: France on North Korea's new nuclear law
52.article_body: France condemned North Korea's new law, which allows it to carry out a preemptive nuclear attack to protect itself. "This new escalation on the part of...North Korea...represents a threat to international and regional peace and security," French Foreign Ministry said. North Korean leader Kim Jong-un called the decision "irreversible" and ruled out the possibility of any talks on denuclearisation.

53.title: Kunal Kamra's Gurugram show cancelled after threats by VHP, Bajrang Dal
53.article_body: The management of a bar in Gurugram has cancelled comedian Kunal Kamra's show, scheduled to take place on September 17 and 18, after members of Bajrang Dal and Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) threatened to protest. In a memorandum submitted to the deputy commissioner, right-wing groups claimed Kamra "mocks Hindu deities in his shows" and requested the show to be cancelled.

54.title: Lucknow hotel fire probe report submitted, 6 depts held responsible; action suggested
54.article_body: Probe report about Hotel Levana fire mishap has been submitted to the state government. The report has held six departments including Lucknow Development Authority (LDA), Lucknow Electricity Supply Administration (LESA), Fire Services, Excise Department, District Administration and Lucknow Municipal Corporation responsible for the incident. Action has been suggested against several officers.

55.title: Don't want SC to be 'tareekh pe tareekh' court: Justice Chandrachud
55.article_body: The Supreme Court refused to grant an adjournment sought by a counsel in a case on Friday. Justice DY Chandrachud said, "We don't want the Supreme Court to be 'tareekh pe tareekh' court. We want to change this perception." "This is the highest court of the land and we want certain dignity to be attached to this court," he added.

56.title: Kangana meets President, says she looks like a goddess on her throne
56.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut on Friday shared pictures on social media of meeting President Droupadi Murmu. The actress wrote alongside the pictures, "Her gentle voice, calm demeanour and compassionate gaze is another worldly...Sitting on that chair/ throne she looks nothing short of a goddess/ Shakti who nurtures, heals and guides." She further wrote that the President appreciated her for her work.

57.title: Artificial ponds to be constructed for immersion of idols in Delhi
57.article_body: Delhi Jal Board Vice Chairman Saurabh Bharadwaj has directed the administration to construct artificial ponds for immersion of idols ahead of Durga Puja festivity. "During Durga Puja in Delhi, huge crowds of devotees gather to celebrate. All necessary instructions have been given to the officials concerned to ensure that there is no problem during the immersion," said Bharadwaj.

58.title: Babar mouths 'I'm captain' after umpire signals DRS without his consent, video viral
58.article_body: A video went viral showing Pakistan captain Babar Azam repeatedly mouthing 'I am the captain' to umpire Anil Chaudhary after the latter signalled DRS without his consent during Sri Lanka's innings. Chaudhary signalled DRS after Muhammad Rizwan appealed for a caught behind and called for DRS. Babar suggested to Chaudhary that he can't signal DRS unless captain gives consent.

59.title: 'Brahmāstra' becomes biggest non-holiday Hindi release
59.article_body: Ayan Mukerji directorial 'Brahmāstra' earned ₹35-36 crore on its opening day, recording the biggest non-holiday opening for a Hindi film. The film's collection has beaten Ranbir Kapoor's highest opener so far 'Sanju' which earned ₹34.75 crore on its opening. SS Rajamouli's 'Baahubali 2: The Conclusion' holds the record for the highest opening on a non-holiday with a ₹41 crore collection.

60.title: Afg lose to everyone, they won't win unless fans change behaviour: Inzamam
60.article_body: Talking about the behaviour of the Afghanistan fans following their team's defeat against Pakistan, ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq said, "I was really shocked...[and] disappointed." "Afghanistan lose to everyone...If the fans don't change their attitude, their team won't win going ahead also," added Inzamam. "It is the second time I am witnessing such shocking behaviour from them," he stated.

61.title: Will be successful in defeating BJP if Opposition is united: Tejashwi
61.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav pitched for Opposition unity for 2024 general elections. Talking about CM Nitish Kumar’s recent meetings with the Opposition leaders including Congress MP Rahul Gandhi in Delhi, he said, “It is a good thing. It has been clearly said that if all of us are united, we will be successful (in defeating BJP).”

62.title: King Charles kissed by woman as he greets people outside Buckingham Palace
62.article_body: Video showing a woman kissing King Charles III on the cheek as he greeted people outside the Buckingham Palace has surfaced online. The new monarch returned to London on Friday after being present when Queen Elizabeth II passed away at Balmoral on Thursday. Another woman was seen kissing the King on the hand.

63.title: IIT graduate fined ₹50,000 by Supreme Court over his 'Kashmir solution' petition
63.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday imposed a fine of ₹50,000 on an IIT graduate over his "Kashmir solution" petition. The petitioner named Prabhakar Venkatesh Deshpande sought implementation of Manmohan-Musharraf 4-point formula. The bench said it is putting the counsel for the petitioner on notice that it will impose cost on him for wasting the court's time with such petitions.

64.title: Virat Kohli's 122* has thrown a spanner in the works: Ravi Shastri
64.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said Virat Kohli's 122* (61) in the Asia Cup match against Afghanistan has "thrown" a "spanner in the works". "It's allowed now for the selectors to think, 'Do we need a third opener?'" added Shastri. "It allows you to have an extra pacer as well as an extra batter in the middle order," he stated.

65.title: BJP comes to Chhattisgarh to learn our development model: Baghel
65.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel criticised BJP and said that the BJP chief JP Nadda was visiting the state to study Congress' development model. "BJP comes here to learn our state model. Our schemes have been adopted by the Centre. BJP doesn't fight alone, uses agencies like ED, IT and CBI," added Baghel.

66.title: Musk cites Twitter's $7.75 mn payout to whistleblower as another reason to end deal
66.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk has sent a third letter to Twitter in an attempt to terminate his $44 billion acquisition of the company. Twitter's $7.75 million payment to whistleblower Peiter Zatko is a violation of merger agreement, Musk's lawyers said in latest notice. Twitter didn't seek Musk's consent for payment nor was it disclosed to him, they added.

67.title: Congress MP shares Sarma's 2010 tweet on Rahul, warns PM about Sarma
67.article_body: After Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma shared a parody video of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, party MP Manickam Tagore on Friday shared a picture of Sarma's 2010 tweet that said, "Rahul Gandhi will [be] Prime Minister of our country in an appropriate time." Tagore questioned whom Sarma was cheating and told PM Narendra Modi that he should "beware" of him.

68.title: BJP names former CM Biplab Deb for Rajya Sabha bypoll in Tripura
68.article_body: The BJP on Friday nominated former Tripura CM Biplab Kumar Deb as the party's candidate for the upcoming bypoll to the lone Rajya Sabha seat in the state. The seat fell vacant after Dr Manik Saha resigned following his appointment as Chief Minister of Tripura. Notably, the announcement came hours after Deb was made Haryana state in-charge by the party.

69.title: Will be more dangerous if jailed: Imran Khan amid terror charges
69.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan, who's facing terrorism charges, warned that he would become "more dangerous" if sent to jail. Khan also expressed discontent over the large police presence outside the Islamabad High Court during the hearing of the case on Thursday. Khan was booked under the Anti-Terrorism Act for allegedly threatening a judge and police officials at a rally.

70.title: 3 children drown during Ganesh idol immersion in Ganga river in UP
70.article_body: Two children drowned and one died during treatment after they went to immerse Ganesh idols in the Ganga river in Uttar Pradesh's Unnao, police said. The incident took place on Friday as the Ganesh Chaturthi festival came to an end. This comes as four children drowned in the Aami river during immersion of Ganesh idols in Sant Kabir Nagar.

71.title: 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz becomes youngest man to reach US Open final in 32 years
71.article_body: Spain's 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz has become the youngest man to reach US Open final since Pete Sampras (19 years) in 1990. The world number four defeated world number 26 France Tiafoe 6-7(6-8), 6-3, 6-1, 6-7(5-7), 6-3 in the US Open 2022 men's singles semi-final. Alcaraz has reached the final of a Grand Slam for the first time.

72.title: Bengaluru reports 337 new COVID-19 cases, no deaths
72.article_body: Bengaluru reported 337 new COVID-19 infections on Friday, taking the cumulative total to 18,68,079 cases, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner said. No new deaths were reported, so the overall toll remained at 16,983. The number of active cases was 2,733, while the infection positivity rate stood at 2.57%.

73.title: Man swims in living room of luxurious villa in flooded Bengaluru; video goes viral
73.article_body: A video showing a man swimming in the living room of a luxurious villa in Bengaluru's Epsilon amid severe waterlogging and floods has gone viral online. The video shows several household items floating around him and a piano submerged in water. Epsilon is home to many businessmen, such as Wipro Executive Chairman Rishad Premji and Britannia Managing Director Varun Berry.

74.title: Ukrainian soldiers write tributes to Queen on bombs before firing them at Russian forces
74.article_body: Ukrainian soldiers wrote tributes to Queen Elizabeth II, who passed away aged 96, on bombs before firing them at Russian forces. Pictures shared on Twitter by a user whose profile described him as a Ukrainian artilleryman in Kyiv's Air Assault Brigade showed "RIP Queen Elizabeth II" written on a bomb. Another picture showed tributes written in Ukrainian.

75.title: US payments company Bolt Financial scraps $1.5 bn deal to buy Wyre
75.article_body: Bolt Financial, the San Francisco-based online payments company, said on Friday that it has scrapped its $1.5 billion deal to buy cryptocurrency infrastructure provider Wyre Payments. Bolt Financial, however, said that it will continue its existing commercial partnership with Wyre Payments. Bolt Financial was valued at $11 billion after a funding round in January this year.

76.title: Chhattisgarh CM inaugurates 2 new districts in state, total district tally now 33
76.article_body: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel inaugurated Manendragarh-Chirmiri-Bharatpur and Sakti as the state's 32nd and 33rd districts on Friday. An official said that Sakti has been carved out from Janjgir-Champa while Manendragarh-Chirmiri-Bharatpur has been formed from Korea district. Baghel talked about long struggle to make Manendragarh-Chirmiri-Bharatpur a district.

77.title: Ukraine has retaken over 1,000 sq km since Sept 1: Zelenskyy
77.article_body: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy claimed that Kyiv's forces have "liberated" more than 1,000 sq km of territory since September 1. Over 30 settlements have been "liberated" in the Kharkiv region, Zelenskyy said. Russia's top official in Kharkiv region, Vitaly Ganchev, confirmed to Russian state TV that Ukrainians had broken through the Russian defence line and had won a "significant victory".

78.title: Congress to release white paper on 'flooded and potholed Bengaluru'
78.article_body: The Congress party said it has formed a committee to bring out a report titled 'Vision Bengaluru, Better Bengaluru' on the city's infrastructure within 20 days. AICC General Secretary Randeep Surjewala said that the committee would release a white paper on the 'flooded and potholed Bengaluru' within a week to "expose the maladministration and corruption".

79.title: Ashneer criticised for calling employees 'daily wagers in guise of salaried folk'
79.article_body: BharatPe's former MD Ashneer Grover was criticised after he called employees "daily wagers in guise of salaried folk" in response to EaseMyTrip Co-founder Prashant Pitti's post on hired candidates backing out at the last minute. A Twitter user wrote, "How do you manage to stoop so low?", while other replied, "Treat them like...daily wagers and they will act...like...daily wagers do."

80.title: ₹61.7 lakh-gold found under seat in flight, seized at Pune airport
80.article_body: Gold biscuits worth ₹61.7 lakh were seized after they were found hidden under the seat in a SpiceJet flight at the Pune International Airport, customs officials said on Friday. The gold biscuits were found in a pouch, wrapped by a black plastic sheet, Pune Customs said. It added that the gold biscuits weigh 1,166.4 gram and are of 999 purity.

81.title: Mason falls from 19th floor as lift cable snaps, dies in Gurugram
81.article_body: A 38-year-old mason died after allegedly falling from the 19th floor of an under-construction building when the cable of the lift he was repairing snapped in Gurugram's Sector 65, police said. The deceased's brother-in-law claimed that he died due to the "negligence of the contractor and builder as they had not provided...any safety equipment". The incident occurred on Wednesday.

82.title: Sweeper, guard die after inhaling toxic gases inside sewer in Delhi
82.article_body: Two men died after inhaling toxic gases while cleaning a sewer in Delhi's Bakkarwala area on Friday. According to police, the victims were identified as Rohit Chandilya, who worked as a sweeper, and security guard Ashok, who went inside the sewer to rescue Chandilya. The two were taken to a nearby hospital where they were declared brought dead, reports said.

83.title: 5 injured as tree falls on Ganpati pandal, car in Thane's Kolbad
83.article_body: Five people were injured after a tree fell on a Ganpati pandal and a car in Kolbad in Maharashtra's Thane city amid heavy rains on Friday. According to Regional Disaster Management Cell (RDMC) chief, Avinash Sawant, the incident took place at around 8 pm near Jagmata temple. "Of the five injured, two...sustained serious wounds and are hospitalised," Sawant added.

84.title: Fan gifts Sonu Sood his painting made with blood, actor says 'donate blood instead'
84.article_body: A fan met and gifted Sonu Sood a painting of him made with blood. Reacting to the video of the meeting, the actor tweeted, "Donate blood, my brother, don't waste it by making my painting with blood. Thank you very much." In the video, the fan can be heard saying that he can sacrifice his life for Sood.

85.title: Australia captain Finch retires from ODI cricket after scoring 26 runs in last 7 innings
85.article_body: Australia's white-ball captain Aaron Finch has announced his retirement from ODI cricket. The third Australia-New Zealand ODI on Sunday will be his last ODI. The 35-year-old's decision comes after scoring 26 runs in his last seven innings. Finch has played 145 ODIs, scoring 5,401 runs, including 17 hundreds. "It has been a fantastic ride with some incredible memories," Finch said.

86.title: IMD predicts rain, issues orange alert in Hyderabad till Sunday
86.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued an orange alert in Hyderabad till Sunday. The city is likely to witness rains that could lead to waterlogging on roads and low-lying areas and cause traffic jams, according to IMD. Water and electricity could be disrupted for a few hours, it added. Notably, Ganesh idol immersions are being undertaken this weekend.

87.title: US President Joe Biden to attend Queen Elizabeth II's funeral
87.article_body: US President Joe Biden has said that he'll attend the funeral of Queen Elizabeth II in Britain. "I don't know the details yet, but I'll be going," Biden told reporters. The date of the funeral has not been confirmed, but it's expected to take place in Westminster Abbey in London on September 19. The Queen died on Thursday aged 96.

88.title: Charles ends his 1st address as King with quote sung at Diana's funeral
88.article_body: King Charles made a reference to a song performed at Princess Diana's funeral as he paid tribute to his mother the Queen on Friday evening. Ending his address, King Charles III said, "May flights of angels sing thee to thy rest." It was a reference to lyrics from Song for Athene, which was performed at Diana's funeral in 1997.

89.title: Said 'can't get film so easily', Anurag said 'Are you mad': Huma on film offer
89.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi said filmmaker Anurag Kashyap told her that he would cast her in a movie when she had first come to Mumbai. "I said, 'I've just come to Bombay. I've heard you have to struggle a lot. You can't get a film so easily.' Then he is like, 'Are you mad?' I am like 'A bit.'," she added.

90.title: 6 die in Haryana's Sonipat, Mahendragarh during Ganesh idol immersion; CM expresses grief
90.article_body: Four people died in Mahendragarh while two others died in Sonipat in Haryana during the Lord Ganesha idol immersion on Friday. Nine youths had been swept away in a canal in Mahendragarh. While four died, others were rescued. Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar expressed his condolences. "We...stand with the families of...deceased in this difficult time," he wrote on Twitter.

91.title: Pilot announces Queen Elizabeth II's death before landing in London, video surfaces
91.article_body: A video of a British Airways pilot making a mid-flight announcement about the death of Queen Elizabeth II has surfaced online. "The Queen passed away earlier today...I thought at the moment I should at least tell you...because I know many will be very, very sad about this," the pilot said 40 minutes before landing at the Heathrow Airport in London.

92.title: Max Verstappen, AlphaTauri's Tsunoda get grid penalties for Italian GP
92.article_body: Red Bull F1 driver Max Verstappen is set to reportedly take another grid penalty during the 2022 Italian GP for changing an engine component. AlphaTauri's Yuki Tsunoda has meanwhile been confirmed to get a 10-place penalty for accumulating reprimands from the race stewards. Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton, Haas' Mick Schumacher and Alfa Romeo's Valtteri Bottas are also taking penalties.

93.title: Liverpool looking to replace Jurgen Klopp with Luis Enrique: Report
93.article_body: Liverpool are reportedly looking to replace manager Jurgen Klopp with Spain national team head coach Luis Enrique emerging as the frontrunner for the post. Liverpool have managed to win only two matches from seven games across all competitions this season. A report claimed Liverpool have already contacted Enrique but Klopp might be given time till January.

94.title: MakeMyTrip announces India’s 15 most-loved homestays of 2022
94.article_body: MakeMyTrip shared that it has released the list of India's Favourite Homestays Awards (IFHA) winners in association with The Times of India. Chosen by 5,00,000+ consumer votes across India and assessed by an expert jury that included Twinkle Khanna, this list of 15 homestays in India is a must-try for your next vacation, said MakeMyTrip.

95.title: ₹32 lakh seized after ED raids on Punjab MLA, others in bank fraud case
95.article_body: The ED on Friday seized hard drives and ₹32 lakh in cash after raiding the premises of Punjab AAP MLA Jaswant Singh Gajjan Majra and others. Raids were conducted on directors of Tara Corporation Limited and their associates in an alleged bank loan fraud. The ED said the accused inflated TCL's turnover through "bogus firms" and siphoned off loan funds.

96.title: India's kharif rice output to fall due to less sowing area: Govt
96.article_body: India's rice production could decrease by around 6.5 million tonnes during this year's Kharif season due to reduction in sowing area, the government said. However, the government asserted there will be surplus output. On Thursday, a ban on exporting broken rice was imposed. Further, export duty of 20% on non-basmati rice was also imposed.

97.title: Direct tax collection rose by 35% this fiscal till Sep 8: IT data
97.article_body: Direct tax collection, which includes personal income tax, increased by 35.46% to ₹6.48 lakh crore in the current financial year till September 8, according to the Income Tax (IT) Department's data. Direct tax collection after net refunds stood at ₹5.29 lakh crore. The country's GDP growth was at 13.5% in the first quarter of this fiscal ending June 30, 2022.

98.title: WHO launching $1.5 billion campaign against meningitis in Africa
98.article_body: The World Health Organization (WHO) said it is launching a $1.5 billion campaign to eliminate bacterial meningitis across Africa by 2030. WHO Regional Director, Africa, Matshidiso Moeti said "a next generation" vaccine against meningitis will be available in the worst-affected countries. Over 50 million African children had their meningitis vaccinations delayed due to the COVID-19 outbreak.

99.title: Section 144 imposed in J&K's Rajouri due to 'communal tension'
99.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir administration imposed prohibitory orders under Section 144 in Rajouri town on Friday citing “communal tension”. The decision was taken following a group's procession call after Friday prayers over a land dispute. With the order, the assembly of four or more people in public places has been restrained.

100.title: Sweden set for election on Sep 11 amid concerns over energy bills
100.article_body: Sweden is set for Parliamentary elections on Sunday, with rising energy costs due to the Russia-Ukraine war and violent crimes at home being the most-discussed topics. Prime Minister Magdalena Andersson of the Social Democrats currently enjoys a high approval rating. Andersson became Sweden's first female prime minister less than a year ago.

101.title: Chinese shadowing our warships in South China Sea: Australia
101.article_body: Australia's Navy chief Vice Admiral Mark Hammond on Friday said the Chinese Navy's "unusual behaviour" of shadowing Australian warships in South China Sea hadn't deterred operations. "Routinely whenever we have a ship up there, there's a PLA (People's Liberation Army) navy vessel...following us around," he said. Hammond was speaking ahead of next week's multination naval exercise 'Kakadu'.

102.title: EU & Thailand seal partnership deal ending years of strained ties
102.article_body: The European Union (EU) and Thailand sealed a Partnership and Cooperation Agreement (PCA) on Friday, as both sides make efforts to repair relations which were strained following a military coup in Bangkok in 2014. This is the EU's sixth PCA agreement with a Southeast Asian country. The PCA improves bilateral ties on multiple issues, including human rights, and counterterrorism.

103.title: Saba shares dad Mansoor's pic with Queen Elizabeth II, says 'End of an era'
103.article_body: Late Indian cricketer Mansoor Ali Khan Pataudi's daughter Saba Pataudi took to Instagram to share a picture of him with Queen Elizabeth II, who passed away on Thursday. "An end of an Era. R.I.P #queenelizabeth...She'll be remembered. #Lord's #cricket #ground," she wrote. In the picture, Mansoor is seen standing next to the Queen, as she shook hands with other cricketers.

104.title: Former Union Ministers, ex-CMs handed state party roles by BJP
104.article_body: The BJP has announced in-charges, co-in-charges and 'prabharis' for 15 states, including poll-bound northeast states. National General Secretary Tarun Chugh is now the new Telangana 'prabhari', while former Tripura CM Biplab Kumar Deb has been appointed for Haryana. Sambit Patra is the coordinator for northeast states and former I&B minister Prakash Javadekar is the 'prabhari' for Kerala.

105.title: 4 children drown in UP's Aami river during immersion of Ganesh idol
105.article_body: Four children drowned in Aami river in Uttar Pradesh's Sant Kabir Nagar during the immersion of Ganesh idol on Friday, police officials said. The bodies were recovered with the help of fishermen and have been sent for postmortem. The deceased were identified as six-year-old Pauphia, six-year-old Ajit, eight-year-old Ruby and 11-year-old Dipali, Superintendent of Police said.

106.title: King Charles delivers 1st speech as British monarch, says 'My mother was an inspiration'
106.article_body: King Charles III delivered his first speech as Britain's monarch on Friday and paid tribute to his mother Queen Elizabeth II, who passed away aged 96. "Throughout her life...my beloved mother was an inspiration and example to me and...all my family," said Charles. "We owe her the most heartfelt debt any family can owe to their mother," he added.

107.title: I'd love Carlos Alcaraz to win 30 Grand Slams: Coach Juan Carlos
107.article_body: Praising world number four Carlos Alcaraz after he reached his maiden Grand Slam semi-final at US Open, his coach Juan Carlos said, "I'd love for him to win 30 Grand Slams. He has a chance of winning many." He added, "First step is to win the first." The 19-year-old beat 11th-seeded Jannik Sinner in five hours 15 minutes in quarter-final.

108.title: One of the best: Patrick on Alcaraz-Sinner's 5hr 15min US Open quarter-final
108.article_body: Commenting on the quarter-final match between Carlos Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner at US Open 2022, Simona Halep's coach Patrick Mouratoglou said it was probably "one of the best matches" he has seen in a long time. Alcaraz beat Sinner 6-3, 6-7(7-9), 6-7(0-7), 7-5, 6-3 in five hours 15 minutes. It was the second-longest match in the history of US Open.

109.title: What is the protocol for internet shutdowns?: SC to Centre
109.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday asked the Centre whether there is a protocol for internet shutdowns. The apex court was hearing a plea which alleged arbitrary internet shutdowns in Arunachal Pradesh, Gujarat, Rajasthan and West Bengal. The SC bench said instead of issuing notices to the four states, notice should be sent to the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology.

110.title: Congress should refuel in BJP states during 'Bharat Jodo': HS Puri
110.article_body: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri has "advised" the Congress to refuel their vehicles in BJP-ruled states to save money during the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. "Congress leaders can save around ₹1,050 to ₹2,205 per diesel vehicle while traversing through 12 states- 3,500 km," said Puri's tweet. He tweeted a graphic which claimed that fuel in BJP-ruled states is comparatively cheaper.

111.title: PM Modi discusses energy, climate, blue economy with Norwegian PM
111.article_body: PM Narendra Modi had a telephone conversation with his Norwegian counterpart Jonas Gahr Støre on Friday. They discussed bilateral and international issues including initiatives to mobilise climate finance for renewable energy projects in developing countries. "[They discussed their] cooperation in the fields of...climate...investments and blue economy," the Norwegian Prime Minister's Office said.

112.title: Sri Lanka defeat Pakistan in Super 4 stage ahead of their Asia Cup 2022 final
112.article_body: Sri Lanka defeated Pakistan by five wickets in the last Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage match. Put into bat first, Pakistan were dismissed for 121, with Sri Lanka spinner Wanindu Hasaranga registering bowling figures of 4-0-21-3. Sri Lanka chased down the target in 17 overs, with their opener Pathum Nissanka scoring an unbeaten 55 off 48 deliveries.

113.title: Pakistan rehire Matthew Hayden as mentor for T20 World Cup
113.article_body: The Pakistan Cricket Board has rehired former Australia cricketer Matthew Hayden as the team mentor for the ICC T20 World Cup in Australia. Hayden had an earlier stint with Pakistan during last year's T20 World Cup in UAE. "I welcome Matthew Hayden...He is a proven performer with his credentials acknowledged and recognised world-over," said PCB Chairman Ramiz Raja.

114.title: Last year was very new experience, balancing was difficult: Neeraj Chopra
114.article_body: Olympic gold medallist Neeraj Chopra said commercial obligations and social commitments took a toll on him last year but he has learnt from his experience. "Last year was a very new experience for me, balancing was difficult," said Chopra. He added that during the off-season he worked on his technique, which helped him win the Diamond League final.

115.title: What are Kohli and Sachin's all-format stats after 71 international hundreds?
115.article_body: Virat Kohli on Thursday smashed his 71st hundred in his 522nd innings in international cricket. Sachin Tendulkar had reached 71 international hundreds in 523 innings. Kohli scored 24,002 runs in his first 522 innings in international cricket, while Sachin had aggregated 23,274 runs in his first 523 innings. Kohli's average after 71 international hundreds is 53.81, while Sachin's was 49.51.

116.title: India already united: Anurag Thakur on Cong's 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'
116.article_body: Criticising the Congress over 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Friday said India is already united under PM Narendra Modi's leadership. "The double-engine (BJP) government in both the Centre and State has worked together to take the state and country forward," Thakur said. "We can't let the country get divided and must work with unity," he added.

117.title: My English has improved but is not very good yet: Neeraj Chopra
117.article_body: Olympic gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra, who became the first Indian to win Diamond Trophy on Thursday, said his English has improved but isn't "very good" yet. "However...I've learnt it to a point where I understand what others want to say...make others understand what I want to say. Athletics is a global sport & knowing basics help," he added.

118.title: India's WC-winning captains Dhoni, Kapil Dev watch US Open match together, pic viral
118.article_body: India's World Cup-winning captains MS Dhoni and Kapil Dev were spotted watching Carlos Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner's US Open men's quarter-final match. Reacting to video that surfaced online showing Dhoni and Kapil watching the match at Arthur Ashe Stadium, a fan tweeted, "They're being identified and getting roars even in US." Kapil also shared a picture of him with Dhoni.

119.title: Sabalenka wears sunglasses at press conference to hide tears after losing US Open semi
119.article_body: World number six Aryna Sabalenka wore sunglasses and a cap at the press conference to hide her tears after losing the US Open women's singles semi-final against world number one Iga Swiatek. The 24-year-old lost the semi-final with a scoreline of 6-3, 1-6, 4-6. "Can't begin to imagine how horrible she feels," a fan tweeted.

120.title: Appreciate Rahul Gandhi’s endeavours: Meghalaya Governor Malik
120.article_body: Meghalaya governor Satya Pal Malik praised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi saying he "appreciates his endeavours" and said he "hoped" the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' will "have some good outcomes for the country". Malik added that the nation's security will be impacted if "its military and farmers were not strong". He also criticised the renaming of Delhi's Rajpath to 'Kartavya Path'.

121.title: Ex-Punjab MLA Simarjeet Bains' bail application rejected in rape case
121.article_body: A court in Punjab's Ludhiana on Friday rejected the bail application of Lok Insaaf Party leader and former Punjab MLA, Simarjeet Singh Bains, in a rape case. Bains' brother and personal assistant, who were also co-accused in the case, had been bailed out on August 12 and 25, respectively. A 44-year-old woman alleged that Bains had raped her multiple times.

122.title: Everyone who called him genius should be jailed: Kangana on Brahmastra director
122.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut has shared a post on her Instagram Stories criticising 'Brahmastra' director Ayan Mukerji. "Everyone who called @ayan_mukerji a genius should be jailed immediately," Kangana wrote, adding, "He took 12 years to make this film, he replaced 14 DOPs...he shot for more than 400 days for this film and changed 85 ADs and burnt ₹600 crores to ashes."

123.title: Hrithik gets angry & shouts at fan after he forcibly takes selfie with actor, video viral
123.article_body: A video shows Hrithik Roshan getting angry after a fan forcibly took a selfie with him. The incident took place when he was leaving a theatre with his sons. Hrithik is seen standing outside his car when the fan blocked his son's way and broke past the security for a selfie. "What are you doing?" Hrithik can be heard shouting.

124.title: Need to be flexible in our batting: Harmanpeet ahead of 1st India-Eng T20I
124.article_body: Ahead of first India Women-England Women T20I, India captain Harmanpreet Kaur said her side needs to be flexible in their batting approach in T20Is. On closing out the matches, Harmanpreet said, "We are working on that. I know for a long time these things are troubling us. We need to show some patience." First T20I will be played on Saturday.

125.title: Video shows Raj man attacking employer with sharp weapons after being sacked
125.article_body: A video showing a man attacking his employer with sharp weapons along with his friends after being allegedly sacked from his job has gone viral on social media. The men in the video are then seen running away from the spot on bikes. The incident reportedly took place in Rajasthan's Kota. The man has reportedly suffered injuries.

126.title: 39.5 kilograms of heroin worth ₹197 crore seized near Kolkata port
126.article_body: The Gujarat Anti-Terrorist Squad (ATS) and Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) detected 39.5 kilograms of heroin worth ₹197.82 crore in 72 hidden packets in Kolkata. "The contraband was found concealed inside 12 gear boxes which were part of 7,220 kilograms of metal scrap sent from Jebel Ali Port in Dubai in a shipping container...[that] reached Kolkata port," Gujarat DGP said.

127.title: Assam CM posts musical video to mock Rahul Gandhi; Congress reacts
127.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Friday mocked Congress leader Rahul Gandhi by posting a musical video on Twitter in which Rahul was portrayed as a cartoon character. The video, entitled 'Rahul naam mera', included references to 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. In response, Congress leader Srinivas BV posted an earlier viral video showing Sarma scratching himself and tweeted, "Himanta naam tera."

128.title: RPF jawan saves woman from going under moving train in UP; video out
128.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing a Railway Protection Force (RPF) jawan saving a woman from getting under a speeding train in Uttar Pradesh's Firozabad. The video showed the woman crossing a railway track and trying to get onto the platform. The jawan was seen rushing towards her and pulling her onto the platform seconds before the train passed.

129.title: All football games in England postponed until Monday, cricket to go ahead
129.article_body: All football fixtures in England have been postponed until Monday due to the demise of Queen Elizabeth II, English football's ruling body announced. However, cricket fixtures were suspended on Friday but will resume on Saturday, including the ongoing Test match between England and South Africa. The government has stated that there is "no obligation" to postpone events.

130.title: Kapil Sharma's 'Zwigato' to screen at Busan Film Festival
130.article_body: Comedian-actor Kapil Sharma's film 'Zwigato' is all set for its Asian premiere at the 27th Busan International Film Festival. The news was shared by Applause Entertainment, the production house bankrolling 'Zwigato', on their Instagram handle. The Nandita Das directorial was earlier screened at the Toronto International Film Festival. Kapil plays a food delivery partner in the movie.

131.title: 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is for spreading hatred: BJP leader
131.article_body: BJP MP Jugal Thakor Lokhandwala has criticised Rahul Gandhi's 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' and said it is 'Nafarat failayo Yatra'. "This journey of Rahul Gandhi is to spread hatred," he said. "The way Congress has done the work of dividing the country into caste, region and religion for 60 years, even today, they want to run the same politics," Lokhandwala added.

132.title: Queen Elizabeth's state funeral will be UK's first since 1965
132.article_body: The state funeral that'll be accorded to the late Queen Elizabeth II will be the UK's first such funeral since 1965, with Winston Churchill being the last head of state to get the honour. The Queen's husband Prince Philip was given a royal ceremonial funeral. A state funeral begins with the body of the deceased brought on a gun carriage.

133.title: 3rd England-SA Test to resume on Saturday after suspension due to Queen's death
133.article_body: The third and deciding Test between England and South Africa will resume at The Oval on Saturday after the play was suspended on Friday following Queen Elizabeth II's demise. "All players...coaches will wear black armbands," the England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) said. After the opening day's play was washed out, Saturday's play will be considered to be Day 3.

134.title: 4 people killed after car falls into gorge in Uttarakhand
134.article_body: Four people from Maharashtra were killed and two others injured when the car in which they were travelling fell into a gorge near Shree Ram Tapasthali Ashram in Tehri Garhwal, Uttarakhand. The deceased have been identified as Shivaji Budhkar (53) from Mumbai, Purushottam Dattatreya (37) and Jitesh Lokhande (43) from Thane, and Dharmaraj from Palghar, police said.

135.title: Gambling ring busted in Karnataka's Kalaburagi; 7 held, cash seized
135.article_body: Police have arrested seven persons for gambling in a public space while playing a game of 'Andar Bahar' near Shahabazar Naka in Karnataka's Kalaburagi. Police also seized the deck of cards, along with cash of over ₹1 lakh, they added. The Kalaburagi City Police tweeted and shared the details of the case, along with a press note and pictures.

136.title: 15 passengers injured after 2 buses collide in Punjab's Hoshiarpur
136.article_body: At least 15 passengers were injured when a government bus collided with a minibus of a private transport service in Punjab's Hoshiarpur on Friday, police said. The accident took place in the afternoon when the bus was travelling to Jalandhar from Pathankot, police added. Ten of the injured passengers were discharged from community health centre after getting first aid.

137.title: Was called 'lady Akshay Kumar' as I was doing 4-5 films in a year: Rakul
137.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh in an interview called herself a "workaholic" and said, "When I was working in Telugu films, I did four-five films in a year." "People would jokingly call me 'lady Akshay Kumar'," she added. "I live, breathe and dream cinema, so I'm extremely grateful that I have work. I will never say no to work," said Rakul.

138.title: DK was dropped without any fault of his, Ind should have trusted him: Jaffer
138.article_body: Former cricketer Wasim Jaffer commented on the Indian team's move to drop wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik from the playing XI for majority of the Asia Cup matches. "Karthik was dropped without any of his faults. He didn't even bat in the matches he played...I think team India will be hurt that they didn't show that trust in Karthik," Jaffer said.

139.title: 12-yr-old boy killed in leopard attack in UP's Balrampur
139.article_body: A 12-year-old boy was killed in a leopard attack in Pachperwa town in Balrampur, UP. The incident took place on Thursday night when the deceased, Aman, was returning home, police said. The forest department has been directed to catch the leopard and a team of officials has been sent to provide financial compensation to Aman's family.

140.title: Under no pressure to breach 90m mark: Neeraj after Diamond Trophy win
140.article_body: Olympic gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra, who became the first-ever Indian to win Diamond Trophy after throwing 88.44 metres, said he's under no pressure to breach the 90 metres mark. "It'll happen when it has to," he added. "Medal is more important than the mark. People don't remember the distance, they remember where you finished on...podium," he further said.

141.title: 'Corrupt' to meet same fate as 'rioters': UP CM Yogi Adityanath
141.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Friday warned the 'corrupt' saying they would meet the same fate as 'rioters'. Criticising the previous governments, he said, "The 'daam' (price) of every 'kaam' (work) was already fixed. The racket had made the entire system hollow, by acting like a weevil." "Corruption was in the genes of governments before 2017," he added.

142.title: What is the story behind the black-and-white photo used to announce Queen's death?
142.article_body: The news of Queen Elizabeth II's death was officially announced on social media with a black-and-white photo. According to People, the photograph was clicked more than 15 years ago during a milestone event in the Queen's life. It was clicked at Buckingham Palace in February 2006 for the Queen's 80th birthday by late photographer Jane Bown.

143.title: Ashish Nehra names his Team India squad for T20 World Cup 2022
143.article_body: Ex-India fast bowler Ashish Nehra has named his Team India squad for the T20 World Cup 2022. Nehra included Ravindra Jadeja, Yuzvendra Chahal and Ravichandran Ashwin as spinners in the squad. He also named both Rishabh Pant and Dinesh Karthik in the squad. Nehra further said that he would want Rohit Sharma and KL Rahul to open in the tournament.

144.title: Didn't use my chances: Sabalenka on US Open semis loss vs Swiatek
144.article_body: After failing to get past a Grand Slam semi-final for the third time in her career at US Open 2022, world number six Aryna Sabalenka said she didn't use her chances against top seed Iga Swiatek on Thursday. "She was playing aggressively," she added. It was the fourth time in 2022 that Sabalenka was defeated by the 21-year-old Pole.

145.title: Feels like we have lost our own 'Grand mother': Vaughan on Queen's demise
145.article_body: Former England skipper Michael Vaughan shared his views on the demise of Queen Elizabeth II. "Feels like we have all lost our own Grand mother xxxxx," Vaughan tweeted. "She loved sport, be honoured to play in her memory," England's current Test skipper Ben Stokes tweeted. Former English cricketer Ian Bell also offered his condolences on the Queen's demise.

146.title: Mill worker dies after colleague pumps air into his rectum in MP
146.article_body: A mill worker died after his colleague allegedly pumped air into his rectum with an air compressor machine that was being used to clean flour dust in Madhya Pradesh's Satna. The accused, who was arrested on Friday, had done it "with an intention of fun", according to police. The victim had asked the accused to help him clean his back.

147.title: Country's politics should be free from dynastic politics: Assam CM
147.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Friday criticised Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao and said the country's politics should be free from dynasty politics. Speaking in Hyderabad, Himanta Biswa Sarma said, "CM KCR speaks about BJP-free politics but we speak about dynasty-free politics." "We still see pictures of his son and daughter in Hyderabad," Sarma added.

148.title: Which Indians have slammed hundreds in all formats in international cricket?
148.article_body: Virat Kohli on Thursday became the fourth Indian cricketer to smash hundreds in all three formats in international cricket. Suresh Raina had become the first cricketer to achieve the feat in 2010. Rohit Sharma became the second Indian to slam hundreds in all three formats in 2015. Meanwhile, KL Rahul became the third Indian to achieve the feat in 2016.

149.title: Tripura SIT to probe Bangladeshi infiltration after 27 arrests
149.article_body: A Special Investigation Team (SIT) of Tripura Police will probe the infiltration from Bangladesh into the state after 27 allegedly illegal foreign nationals were detained near Agartala earlier this week. Officials said the move will ensure better coordination between the police and central government agencies. An official said infiltration is being reported from the state's unfenced border areas.

150.title: Cristiano Ronaldo mourns Queen Elizabeth II's death, says 'Irreplaceable loss'
150.article_body: Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo took to Instagram to condole the demise of Queen Elizabeth II. Calling it an "irreplaceable loss", he wrote, "Seven years of my career were played in the Premier League, making this my 8th season living in England. Throughout these years, I've felt the everlasting love of the UK for its Queen."

151.title: SC to begin hearings on criminalising marital rape from Sept 16
151.article_body: The Supreme Court said it will on September 16 hear pleas arising out of the Delhi HC's split verdict on criminalising marital rape. "Otherwise also, this matter has to be heard," said the bench. The HC had delivered a verdict with one judge favouring striking down the exception in the law while the other refused to hold it unconstitutional.

152.title: Army, Air Force conduct 4-day 'Gagan Strike' exercise in Punjab
152.article_body: The Army's Kharga Corps and the Air Force conducted a joint exercise called 'Gagan Strike' over the last four days in Punjab. The exercise comprised deploying attack helicopters in support of ground forces and practising annihilation of enemy defences, a defence spokesperson said. The Apache 64E and Advanced Light Helicopter WSI were used by the Air Force.

153.title: CUET-UG results to be announced by September 15: UGC Chairman
153.article_body: The National Testing Agency (NTA) is expected to announce the CUET-UG results by September 15 or if possible, even a couple of days earlier, University Grants Commission (UGC) Chairman Jagadesh Kumar said on Friday. The Common University Entrance Test for undergraduate admissions (CUET-UG) was conducted in six phases from July 15-August 30. CUET-UG answer keys were released on September 8.

154.title: Virat Kohli will always be remembered as the greatest cricketer: Akhtar
154.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar said Virat Kohli will always be remembered as the "greatest" cricketer, following his 71st international hundred in the match against Afghanistan. Akhtar further termed Kohli as a man made of "steel", adding his wife Anushka Sharma is an "iron lady". "You always support the truth and that's why nothing bad will happen to you," stated Akhtar.

155.title: Jeff Bezos criticises US professor for wishing Queen Elizabeth an 'excruciating' death
155.article_body: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos criticised an associate professor at US' Carnegie Mellon University who said she wished UK's Queen Elizabeth faced "excruciating" pain on her death bed. "This is someone supposedly working to make the world better?" said Bezos on Uju Anya's tweet, adding, "I don't think so." The Queen passed away in Balmoral Castle, Scotland on Thursday.

156.title: Self-proclaimed SP student leader tries to block UP CM's convoy, detained
156.article_body: A self-proclaimed Samajwadi Party (SP) student leader was detained for trying to block the convoy of Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath in Jaunpur on Friday. The accused broke the police cordon and suddenly appeared in front of the convoy waving a black flag and raising slogans in favour of SP chief Akhilesh Yadav. He was immediately taken away by police.

157.title: I have stopped working with A-list actors: Filmmaker Prakash Jha
157.article_body: Filmmaker Prakash Jha has said he has stopped working with A-list actors. "They don't want to work with me either," he added. "I don't want to finish a film in 30 days...because the actor wants to move on to another project. I want to do my project the way I want. Many don't want to work on...difficult script," said Prakash.

158.title: Told Serena 'No disrespect to this generation but you're so much better': Sharapova
158.article_body: Five-time Grand Slam champion Maria Sharapova said she told Serena Williams when the pair met at 2021 Met Gala that there's no disrespect to the current generation of tennis players but "you're so much better". "I'm glad that she had a chance here [US Open 2022]," she added. The 23-time Grand Slam champion was defeated in US Open third round.

159.title: Hugh Jackman's 'The Son' gets 10-min standing ovation at Venice Film Fest
159.article_body: Hugh Jackman and Laura Dern-starrer 'The Son' received a 10-minute standing ovation at Venice International Film Festival on Wednesday. The film, directed by Florian Zeller, centres on "a family as it falls apart and tries to come back together again", according to Sony Pictures Classics' official synopsis. Actors Anthony Hopkins and Vanessa Kirby are also part of 'The Son'.

160.title: 4 men open fire at street dogs in Madhya Pradesh; case registered
160.article_body: A case has been registered against four unidentified persons after they allegedly opened fire at street dogs using air guns at a locality in Madhya Pradesh's Indore. A video of the incident showing the accused firing shots at the dogs went viral on social media. No canines were, however, injured in the firing, police said.

161.title: Old days of Lalu Yadav's regime are back in Bihar: Sushil Modi
161.article_body: BJP MP Sushil Modi commented on the alleged increasing incidents of murder in the JD(U)-RJD-ruled Bihar. "Recently, incidents of murder took place in Patna. It seems like the old days of Lalu Yadav's regime are back," Modi said. He added, "He (Bihar CM) met Lalu Yadav, the symbol of crime and corruption. They can't handle law and order."

162.title: We are for corporate India but against massive monopolies: Rahul
162.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi said that his party is for "corporate India" but "against the idea of massive monopolies". "India now faces a bankruptcy of vision for what the future of our country should be...We are against unfairness, be it against farmers or MSMEs. We will act to ensure fairness prevails," Rahul tweeted.

163.title: TMC leader Mondal, 13 others acquitted in 2010 WB poll violence case
163.article_body: A Kolkata court on Friday cited "lack of evidence" while acquitting Trinamool Congress (TMC) leader Anubrata Mondal and 13 others in the 2010 Mangalkote poll violence case. In 2010, CPI(M) activists were allegedly injured in a clash with TMC supporters in West Bengal. The prosecution couldn't prove that the accused were present at the scene of violence, the court held.

164.title: Pakistan's Asif Ali, Afghanistan's Fareed Ahmad fined 25% of match fee for their fight
164.article_body: Pakistan's Asif Ali and Afghanistan's Fareed Ahmad have been fined 25% of their match fee each for their altercation during their Asia Cup Super 4 stage match. Ahmad gave Asif a send-off after dismissing him, after which Asif pushed and almost hit Ahmad with the bat. The players admitted their offence and accepted sanctions proposed by match referee Andy Pycroft.

165.title: Man confronts Assam CM on stage during Hyd rally, dismantles mic
165.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma was allegedly confronted by a man, who dismantled the microphone on the stage at a rally in Hyderabad on Friday, as per reports. The man has reportedly been identified as a worker of the ruling Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) party. He was later taken off stage by BJP leaders and workers present there, reports added.

166.title: Earth spiralling towards multiple 'irreversible' climate tipping points: Study
166.article_body: With the current warming rate, Earth might cross several climate tipping points by the 2030s, a study has found. According to researchers, climate tipping points are threshold conditions beyond which climate change becomes irreversible and "self-perpetuating". To cut risks and maintain liveable conditions on Earth, greenhouse gas emissions must be reduced rapidly, starting immediately, they said.

167.title: Nepal captain Sandeep issues statement after being accused of rape, says 'I'm innocent'
167.article_body: Nepal cricket team captain Sandeep Lamichhane, who has been accused of raping a 17-year-old girl in a hotel room in Kathmandu, issued a statement, saying he is innocent. He added that he will be taking a break from Caribbean Premier League and go back to Nepal. "May justice be served to the innocent and right investigation be done," he stated.

168.title: Rohit interviews Virat Kohli after his 1st hundred in nearly 3 years, BCCI shares video
168.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma interviewed Virat Kohli after the latter slammed his first hundred in nearly three years. After Rohit asked a question in Hindi, Kohli jokingly responded, "He's speaking in pure Hindi with me for the first time." In the interview, Kohli talked about how the team management gave him space and helped him amid his poor form.

169.title: Army's forward posts along LAC in Arunachal Pradesh to get helipads
169.article_body: Infantry battalions guarding the Line of Actual Control (LAC) with China in Arunachal Pradesh are going to get helipads capable of operating Chinook helicopters for swift mobilisation of troops and military equipment, senior military officials said on Friday. "We're...giving a big push to the infrastructure development in the forward areas in the eastern sector," a Mountain Brigade Commander said.

170.title: Hard to comprehend Queen Elizabeth is no longer with us: World Athletics Prez
170.article_body: Condoling the demise of Queen Elizabeth II, World Athletics President Sebastian Coe tweeted, "The Queen was such a beloved constant in the lives of so many people over so many years that it's hard to comprehend that she's no longer with us." He added, "I'll never forget her total commitment to...success of the London 2012 Olympic and Paralympic Games."

171.title: Royal gun salutes of 96 rounds, marking each year of Queen's life, fired across UK
171.article_body: A day after Queen Elizabeth II passed away on Thursday, Royal gun salutes took place at various places, including London, Belfast, Cardiff and Edinburgh, in the UK. The salutes saw the firing of 96 rounds, marking each year of the Queen's life. The UK is observing a 10-day period of official mourning, starting today (September 9).

172.title: I'm going for everything: Jabeur on her 2nd Grand Slam final at US Open
172.article_body: After reaching her second straight Grand Slam final at US Open 2022, Tunisia's Ons Jabeur said the Wimbledon final was tough for her, adding that she's "going for everything" against world number one Iga Swiatek in Saturday's final in New York. Jabeur became the first African woman to reach the final at US Open in the Open Era.

173.title: BJP has made Bengaluru a city of shutdowns: Karnataka Congress
173.article_body: The Karnataka unit of Congress criticised the BJP's state unit for the ongoing flood crisis in Bengaluru. "From the silicon & startup capital of India, BJP has ensured we have become the city of shutdowns. The government's inefficiency is hurting our city," Congress tweeted. A photo stating "infrastructure disconnected" was also shared by Congress in the tweet.
