348.title: Karthik bowls for 1st time in his international career, gives away 18 runs in 6 balls
348.article_body: Team India wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik on Thursday bowled for the first time ever in his international career. The 37-year-old came to bowl the 20th over of Afghanistan's innings in their Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage match. He gave away 18 runs in the over, including two sixes. Karthik bowled off-spin deliveries.

349.title: India bans exports of broken rice, imposes 20% tax on non-basmati
349.article_body: India, the world's biggest rice exporter, has prohibited exports of broken rice and imposed a 20% levy on shipments of unmilled, semi-milled, wholly-milled and husked brown varieties from Friday, the government said. Some exports will, however, be allowed till September 15 with some conditions. The move will reportedly increase supplies and tame soaring local prices after below-average monsoons.

350.title: Ons Jabeur becomes 1st North African, Arab and Tunisian woman to reach US Open final
350.article_body: World number five Ons Jabeur of Tunisia defeated Caroline Garcia of France 6-1, 6-3 in the women's singles semi-finals to reach the US Open final for the first time. With this, she became the first North African, Arab and Tunisian woman to reach the US Open final. It's Jabeur's second straight Grand Slam final after finishing runner-up at Wimbledon 2022.

351.title: Rainbows appear over Buckingham Palace, Windsor Castle after Queen's death; pics viral
351.article_body: Rainbows appeared in UK after the demise of Queen Elizabeth II aged 96. A rainbow was spotted next to Windsor Castle, the Queen's residence in the English county of Berkshire. A double rainbow was seen over the Buckingham Palace. Reacting to the viral pictures, a social media user wrote, "Couldn't be more appropriate. May she rest in peace."

352.title: Staff bypassed us to cater her: Ishaan on Katrina's entry on 'Phone Bhoot' set
352.article_body: While talking about actress Katrina Kaif's entry on the set of 'Phone Bhoot', actor Ishaan Khatter said that "everything fell silent". "People were talking in hushed tones, and the aura just changed. There were staff literally bypassing us to go cater to her," he said, adding that everything was in chaos before Kaif entered the set.

353.title: Bengaluru reports 262 new COVID-19 cases, no deaths
353.article_body: Bengaluru reported 262 new COVID-19 infections in a day, taking the cumulative total to 18,67,742 cases, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner said on Thursday. No new deaths were reported, so the overall toll remained at 16,983. The number of active cases was 2,746, while the infection positivity rate stood at 3.01%.

354.title: No Ganpati Visarjan at Mumbai's Sanjay Gandhi National Park: Bombay HC
354.article_body: The Bombay High Court on Thursday directed the Maharashtra government to ensure that there is no immersion of Ganesh idols inside Sanjay Gandhi National Park (SGNP) in Mumbai. "If any attempt is made in breach of law then...forest authorities are free to take appropriate steps,'' the bench said. The order came following a PIL filed by city-based NGO 'Mumbai March'.

355.title: India reports 6,093 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 49,636
355.article_body: India has reported 6,093 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 6,395 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 49,636, while the death toll has risen to 5,28,121, according to the latest data.

356.title: Twitter agreed to pay $7 million to whistleblower in June: Report
356.article_body: Twitter agreed in June to pay about $7 million to the whistleblower whose allegations will be part of Elon Musk's case against the company, the Wall Street Journal reported. The whistleblower, Peiter "Mudge" Zatko, accused the social media firm of falsely claiming it had a solid security plan and making misleading statements about its defences against hackers and spam accounts.

357.title: Pet dog bites off chunk of boy's face in Ghaziabad; pic shows him after 150 stitches
357.article_body: A pet pitbull bit off a chunk of 11-year-old boy's face in Ghaziabad recently, following which the boy was hospitalised and received around 150 stitches. The boy's father said that the dog attacked the boy in a park after the dog's leash slipped from its owner's hand. The dog's owner has been fined ₹5,000 for not registering the dog.

358.title: Show us proof: Russia on US' claim Moscow seeking arms from N Korea
358.article_body: The US and the UK should provide proof to support their allegations that Moscow was seeking drones from Iran and rockets and artillery shells from North Korea to use in Ukraine, Russia's UN Ambassador said, addressing the UN Security Council. "Either provide us with evidence or acknowledge that you are disseminating unreliable information," Ambassador Vassily Nebenzia said on Thursday.

359.title: ED raids premises of Punjab AAP MLA Jaswant Singh Majra: Reports
359.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) reportedly raided the premises of Aam Aadmi Party's Punjab MLA Jaswant Singh Gajjan Majra. ED reportedly carried out searches at Tara Haveli in Sangrur, Tara Convent School, Tara Golden Homes and Tara Feed Industry in Malerkotla, all linked to Majra. This comes four months after CBI raided his three Sangrur-located properties in an alleged bank fraud case.

360.title: 22-yr-old student dies by suicide after failing NEET-UG in Gr Noida
360.article_body: A 22-year-old female student allegedly died by suicide at her society in Greater Noida's Sector-151 on Thursday after she failed her NEET-UG exam. The deceased was stressed after failing the exam and her body has been sent for post-mortem, according to the police. This comes after a 19-year-old girl allegedly died by suicide in Chennai after failing the NEET-UG exam.

361.title: Biden signs condolence book for Queen Elizabeth II at UK embassy
361.article_body: US President Joe Biden and First Lady Jill Biden visited the British Embassy in Washington DC to sign a condolence book for Queen Elizabeth II. "We mourn for all of you. She was a great lady. I'm so delighted I got to meet her," Biden told embassy staff after signing the book. The Queen, Britain's longest-serving monarch, died on Thursday.

362.title: Govt offices, schools in Hyd to be closed today for Ganpati Visarjan
362.article_body: Telangana announced a holiday for government offices, schools and colleges in and around the twin cities of Hyderabad and Secunderabad, Ranga Reddy and Medchal-Malkajgiri districts on account of Ganesh idols immersion processions on Friday. The government added that November 12, which is the second Saturday, will be a working day in lieu of the holiday on Friday.

363.title: Pune civic body arranges 204 mobile tanks for immersion of idols
363.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation has arranged 204 mobile tanks and 303 artificial ponds in the city for the immersion of Ganesh idols on Friday. The civic body is also collecting idols at 216 places and along with an NGO, it is also collecting 'nirmalya', the flowers offered to Lord Ganesh. The flowers will be used to prepare fertilisers.

364.title: First he was Rumi with long hair: Ayan on Ranbir's Brahmastra character Shiva
364.article_body: Filmmaker Ayan Mukerji took to Instagram to share a picture of actor Ranbir Kapoor from an early look test for 'Brahmastra'. He revealed that Kapoor's character who is now named Shiva was earlier called Rumi. "First, he was Rumi. Rumi with long hair...we gave Ranbir a haircut, and Rumi became...Shiva," he wrote in the caption.

365.title: 4-yr-old swept away in drain following heavy rain in Thane, search underway
365.article_body: A four-year-old boy was swept away in a drain on a waterlogged street in Thane's Kalwa area following heavy rainfall on Thursday. According to Regional Disaster Management Cell (RDMC) chief Avinash Sawant, water in the locality was around four feet deep. "We...got...information about a four-year-old who was feared drowned and a search operation has been initiated," Sawant added.

366.title: Amritsar-born Devika Bulchandani appointed CEO of global advertising agency Ogilvy
366.article_body: Amritsar-born Devika Bulchandani has been appointed as the Global Chief Executive Officer of advertising agency Ogilvy, which has presence in 93 countries. Devika, who was serving as Global President and CEO of Ogilvy North America, succeeds Andy Main who is stepping down as Global CEO and will serve as a Senior Advisor until the end of the year.

367.title: Anushka shares pics of Kohli after he hits ton, says 'Forever with you through everything'
367.article_body: Anushka Sharma took to Instagram to share pictures of Virat Kohli celebrating after slamming his first international hundred in nearly three years. "Forever with you through any and everything," she wrote. Kohli dedicated his hundred to Anushka and their daughter Vamika. Kohli scored 122*(61) against Afghanistan on Thursday, his first-ever T20I hundred.

368.title: ABD shares pic with Kohli on scooter, says 'With his 100 I thought I’d share this memory'
368.article_body: Ex-South Africa captain AB de Villiers on Thursday took to social media to share an old picture of himself with Virat Kohli on a scooter. He captioned the picture, "With his 100 today...I thought I'd share this memory...Top knock...my friend. Many more to come." "Thanks biscuit. Love you," Kohli commented on his post. Meanwhile, Anushka Sharma commented, "Oh my god."

369.title: What is Operation Unicorn, activated in UK after Queen's death?
369.article_body: Funeral plans for UK Queen Elizabeth II codenamed 'London Bridge' were leaked in the media last year, however, due to her demise in Scotland, it was codenamed to 'Operation Unicorn', according to reports. The day of Queen's death will be referred to as D-Day. As a part of the operation, BBC presenters wore black and channels switched to rolling news.

370.title: 'Chor Raja' wanted in over 100 cases arrested by Pune Police
370.article_body: Pune Police arrested a criminal, identified as Rajesh Ram Papul aka 'Chor Raja', who was wanted in over 100 cases. Following his arrest from his house, the 37-year-old criminal has been remanded to police custody till September 12. It was only after installing a GPS machine in his fiancée's footwear that police were able to arrest him, an officer said.

371.title: Govt to form authority to manage traffic in Bengaluru: CM Bommai
371.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Thursday said that an authority will be formed to manage traffic in Bengaluru and that a bill to this effect will be introduced in the upcoming Assembly session. He added that several tasks are being undertaken by NHAI, BBMP, PWD and other departments and a comprehensive master plan will resolve most of the problems.

372.title: It was quite shocking for me that my 60s became failures: Virat Kohli on criticism
372.article_body: Referring to criticism he faced during his 1,019-day international century drought, Virat Kohli said, "What actually surprised me was my 60s became failures which was quite shocking for me." He added, "I was...batting pretty well and contributing but it didn't seem to be good enough. Kohli slammed a hundred after 1,019 days on Thursday, registering 122*(61) against Afghanistan.

373.title: Video of Kohli telling Bhuvneshwar 'Abhi hai cricket baaki' after smashing ton goes viral
373.article_body: A video of Team India batter Virat Kohli telling his teammate Bhuvneshwar Kumar 'Abhi hai cricket baaki (There's still cricket left)' after smashing a hundred after nearly three years has gone viral. Kohli made the remark when he was being greeted by his teammates following India's innings against Afghanistan in their Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage match on Thursday.

374.title: What will be the new Royal titles of Queen's son Charles, Prince William and Kate?
374.article_body: After the death of Queen Elizabeth II, her son Charles will be crowned King Charles III. Charles' son Prince William, and William's wife are now titled Duke and Duchess of Cornwall and Cambridge. William will not automatically become Prince of Wales - that will have to be conferred on him by his father. Charles' wife, Camilla, becomes the Queen Consort.

375.title: Mumbai witnesses heavy rain, IMD predicts thunderstorms; yellow alert issued
375.article_body: Mumbai received heavy rainfall on Thursday. The India Meteorological Department has predicted thunderstorms with lightning, light to moderate rainfall and gusty winds in the city. A yellow alert was also issued for Mumbai. The rainfall started at around 4:30 pm and intensified between 5 to 6 pm. Reports said that rail and road traffic was affected due to rains.

376.title: Noida Power Company Limited employee electrocuted during repair work
376.article_body: A man working with the Noida Power Company Limited was electrocuted to death while repairing power lines in Sector 10. "Another lineman told us that the power on the line he was fixing was shut...line he was working on became live," the deceased's nephew said. The line that the man was working on was switched on suddenly, the nephew added.

377.title: Congress leader Siddaramaiah visits flooded areas in B'luru on boat
377.article_body: Senior Congress leader Siddaramaiah on Thursday took a boat ride to the flood-affected areas in Bengaluru and interacted with the locals. He met the residents of Epsilon residential complex in Yemalur, which is home to some of the biggest entrepreneurs in Bengaluru. Further, he visited the residence of the 23-year-old woman who was recently electrocuted to death in Bengaluru.

378.title: There was nobody like her: Donald Trump on Queen Elizabeth II's demise
378.article_body: Condoling Queen Elizabeth II's demise, former US President Donald Trump said, "What a grand and beautiful lady she was—there was nobody like her!" He further said, "Melania and I will always cherish our time together with the Queen, and never forget Her Majesty’s generous friendship, great wisdom, and wonderful sense of humor."

379.title: Joe Biden releases statement on Queen Elizabeth II's demise, says 'She defined an era'
379.article_body: US President Joe Biden and First Lady Jill Biden released a statement following the demise of Queen Elizabeth II. "[She] was more than a monarch. She defined an era," the statement read. "She stood in solidarity with...US during our darkest days after 9/11...when she poignantly reminded us that 'Grief is the price we pay for love'," the statement added.

380.title: Need more opportunities for Indian startups' ideas to go global: Goyal
380.article_body: Speaking in the US, Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said that Indian startups need more opportunities so that their ideas can reach out to the global market and stated that "Silicon Valley is the best place for an idea to go global". He added that the government is playing the role of facilitator between Indian startups and US-based investors.

381.title: Neeraj Chopra creates history, becomes first-ever Indian to win Diamond Trophy
381.article_body: Olympic gold medal-winning Indian javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra has created history by becoming the first-ever Indian to win Diamond Trophy. The 24-year-old won the Diamond League final in Zurich with a best throw of 88.44 metres. Apart from the Diamond Trophy, Neeraj also won a prize money of $30,000.

382.title: Target drops mandatory CEO retirement age, Cornell to stay for 3 more yrs
382.article_body: US-based merchandise retailer Target has dropped the mandatory retirement age for its CEO. This would allow CEO Brian Cornell to serve the position for three more years. Under Cornell's leadership, who took the position in 2014, the chain has expanded its customer base and accelerated its curbside pickups, online and same-day services.

383.title: Starbucks to rehire 7 fired Memphis workers after losing appeal
383.article_body: Starbucks will rehire seven employees who were fired after leading an effort to unionise Memphis store. Starbucks, which opposes unionisation, said employees violated company policy by reopening the store post-closing time and inviting non-employees. The National Labour Relations Board said Starbucks was interfering with workers' right to organise and asked a federal court in Memphis to intervene.

384.title: Friday's play in 3rd England-SA Test to not take place due to Queen Elizabeth II's demise
384.article_body: The second day's play in the third England-South Africa Test at Kennington Oval in London will not take place on Friday as scheduled due to the demise of Queen Elizabeth II, the England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) announced. Further, all scheduled matches in the Rachael Heyhoe Flint Trophy, will also not take place on Friday.

385.title: Nothing more noble than to devote life to service of others: Tim Cook on Queen's demise
385.article_body: Apple CEO Tim Cook took to Twitter to condole the demise of Queen Elizabeth II. He wrote, "There's nothing more noble than to devote your life to the service of others. We stand with the people of the UK and Commonwealth in honoring the life and dedication to duty of her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II."

386.title: King Charles issues statement after Queen's death, says 'Her loss will be deeply felt'
386.article_body: Following Queen Elizabeth II's demise, her son King Charles said, "The death of my beloved Mother, Her Majesty The Queen, is a moment of the greatest sadness for me and all members of my family." "I know her loss will be deeply felt throughout the country, the Realms and the Commonwealth, and by countless people around the world," he added.

387.title: Not my career or personal goal: Idris Elba on playing James Bond
387.article_body: Idris Elba said playing James Bond is not a goal for his career and he doesn't think it will "satisfy some of my personal goals". However, he said if he's cast as the spy, it'll "definitely satisfy the will of a nation". Idris added, "I'm not that guy, but in everyone's world I might be. And that - job done."

388.title: Yami Gautam's 'Lost' to open Chicago South Asian Film Festival
388.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam's upcoming film 'Lost' will serve as the opening film at the Chicago South Asian Film Festival (CSAFF). Reacting to the news, Yami said she "can't be happier and more proud". Yami said working on the Aniruddha Roy Chowdhury directorial was a "special experience" as it allowed her to explore "many layers of emotions as an actor".

389.title: Prince Charles becomes UK King after death of Queen Elizabeth II
389.article_body: Prince Charles has become the King of UK after the death of his mother, Queen Elizabeth II. The 73-year-old had been next in line to the throne for seven decades. Meanwhile, his wife Camilla has become the Queen Consort. Queen Elizabeth II passed away aged 96 at Balmoral on Thursday.

390.title: Ranbir visits Lalbaugcha Raja with Ayan ahead of 'Brahmastra' release
390.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor and Ayan Mukerji visited Lalbaugcha Raja on Thursday to seek blessings of Lord Ganesh for their film 'Brahmastra'. On his Instagram account, Ayan shared that he is "so excited for everyone to experience" the film in theatres. Slated for September 9 release, 'Brahmastra' features Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor sharing the screen space for the first time.

391.title: PM Modi shares old pics with Queen Elizabeth II, says 'Pained by her demise'
391.article_body: Condoling the demise of Queen Elizabeth II, PM Narendra Modi tweeted, "I had memorable meetings with Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II during my UK visits in 2015 and 2018. I'll never forget her warmth and kindness." "Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II will be remembered as a stalwart...She provided inspiring leadership to her nation and people...Pained by her demise," he added.

392.title: Kapil is & will remain at the top of his game: Archana Puran Singh
392.article_body: Archana Puran Singh on Thursday shared a video, which also featured Kapil Sharma. Along with the post, Archana wrote about Kapil and said he "is and always will remain at the top of his game" because of his ability to bring humour to everything. Commenting on his latest look, Archana revealed Kapil's wife Ginni Chatrath was behind his "sartorial transformation".

393.title: What jungle raj? There is janta raj in Bihar: CM Nitish Kumar
393.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Thursday dismissed BJP's claim that 'jungle raj' (lawlessness) has returned to the state after the Mahagathbandhan government came to power. "What jungle raj? Maintaining law and order has been [our] priority...There's janta raj," he added. He stated that BJP leaders Sushil Modi and Sanjay Jaiswal may get "plum posts" in the party for criticising him.

394.title: Rajasthan Zila Parishad member arrested for taking bribe
394.article_body: A Rajasthan Zila Parishad member was arrested by the Anti-Corruption Bureau in Bikaner for taking a bribe of ₹10 lakh. The Bikaner Zila Parishad member had asked for a bribe of ₹21 lakh from a complainant to take action in a land-related matter. After the complaint was verified, a trap was laid and the accused was arrested.

395.title: Olympian Dutee Chand to join 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10' as wild card
395.article_body: Olympian Dutee Chand will be entering 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10' as a wild card. Talking about the show, Dutee said she is excited about the challenge and will "perform to the best of my capabilities". She added, "I am used to performing in front of live viewers, but this is going to be a new experience altogether."

396.title: NGT imposes ₹12,000 cr fine on Maha for environmental norms violation
396.article_body: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) on Thursday imposed a fine of ₹12,000 crore on the state of Maharashtra for allegedly not managing solid and liquid waste, causing harm to the environment. Without fixing quantified liability necessary for restoration, mere passing of orders has not shown any tangible results, the NGT said. The penalty has to be paid within two months.

397.title: Perfume trader Piyush Jain released on bail after 8 months
397.article_body: Uttar Pradesh perfume trader Piyush Jain was released on bail after 8 months in jail, officials said. Last year, his premises were raided by central agencies, and around ₹200 crore in cash and 23 kg of gold were seized. His bail plea was accepted by the Allahabad High Court, and his family members filed two sureties each of ₹10 lakh.

398.title: Corruption by a civil servant is offence against society: SC
398.article_body: Corruption by a civil servant is an offence against society and state, the Supreme Court said on Thursday. The court made the observation while hearing a Madras High Court order which dismissed a criminal complaint in a cash­-for-­job scam, citing settlement between parties. The apex court held the High Court was "completely in error in quashing the criminal complaint".

399.title: Queen Elizabeth II, Britain's longest-serving monarch, passes away aged 96
399.article_body: Queen Elizabeth II, Britain's longest-serving monarch, has passed away aged 96. On Thursday, Buckingham Palace had released a statement saying she was under medical supervision as her doctors were concerned for her health. The monarch had been facing health problems since October last year that left her with difficulties walking and standing.

400.title: Vicky's principles and values were so overwhelming: Katrina
400.article_body: Actress Katrina Kaif said husband Vicky Kaushal's "principles and values" were "overwhelming" for her. Explaining Vicky's bond with his family, Katrina said she knew he'd give the same kind of respect and importance to his wife and kids. She said with time, she understood what's important in a relationship and "what's going to take you through in the long run".
